text.section:
A subsidy provided to a small employer under the Program:
shall offset a portion of the small employer health benefit plan premium contributions made by a small employer;
may not exceed the lower of:
50% of the small employer contribution; or
an amount established by the Commission; and
may be calculated on a sliding scale.

A subsidy provided to an employee of a small employer under the Program:
shall offset a portion of the small employer health benefit plan premium contributions made by an employee;
may not exceed the lower of:
50% of the employee contribution; or
an amount established by the Commission; and
may be calculated on a sliding scale.
The Commission may alter the subsidy amounts provided under subsections (b) and (c) of this section according to the number of employees of the small employer.
The total amount of all subsidies provided under this section shall be subject to the limitations of the State budget.
